Organisation Purpose Amount USD Country Programme Sub Programme Year Awarded Duration
dZi Foundation To provide core support to dZi for its work in Nepal. Over the next four years, dZi aims to expand its 'deep development' work in eastern Nepal to reach more than 41,000 people living in 12 communities. These communities are some of the few remaining subsistence farming societies in Nepal and on the globe. dZi works to introduce global benefits and resources to members of these communities while helping them to preserve their important culture, customs and way of life. 400'000.00 United States Special Interest 2017 47 months (01 Jan 2018-31 Dec 2021)
dZi Foundation To increase economic resilience for 4,000 households in extremely remote communities in eastern Nepal. dZi will work with 3,700 farmers to grow and sell cash crops as well as increase vegetable consumption and food security. It will also form and support three multi-purpose cooperatives to grow to a total of 1,300 members and to provide special support to 386 families who lost homes during the recent earthquakes. 300'000.00 Nepal Special Interest 2016 36 months (1 Mar 2016-28.02.2019)
Earth Rights International To work in partnership with communities and civil society organisations in Myanmar in defence of human rights and the environment through training, public advocacy and legal interventions. ERI is a not-for-profit organisation that combines the power of law and the power of people to defend human rights and the environment. 500'000.00 Myanmar International Human Rights Supporting and protecting human rights defenders 2018 35 months (1 Sep 2018-31 Aug 2021)
East Carolina University To support the continued expansion of the College STAR network in the United States in order to strengthen a nation-wide network of educational professionals and services, both in K-12 and postsecondary environments, committed to increasing postsecondary opportunities for students with learning differences. The College STAR mission will be infused into the three anchor campuses (East Carolina University, Appalachian State University and Fayetteville State University), and monitored by common evaluation and research processes. An active network of collaborators from multiple stakeholders across the US will be in place. 1'498'737.00 United States Learning Differences 2017 23 months (01 Jan 2018-31 Dec 2019)
East Carolina University To support students with learning disabilities to enroll in and graduate from East Carolina University (ECU). Students in Project STEPP, housed at ECU, remain in college at rates that exceed the general university population. STEPP aims for graduation rates of participants with learning disabilities to match or exceed the six-year graduation rate of the university. 660'109.00 United States Learning Differences 2015 59 months (1 Sep 2015-31 Aug 2020)
East Durham Children's Initiative To provide high-quality services to children and families of East Durham, North Carolina. East Durham Children's Initiative focuses on the following priorities: increasing out-of-school learning opportunities for youth; developing middle and high school programming; exploring opportunities to scale services; and creating anew service delivery model that will increase its reach while providing individualised academic and social-emotional supports for youth. 2'500'000.00 United States Special Interest 2018 59 months (1 Jul 2018-30 Jun 2023)

ECPAT International To support the efforts of ECPAT International in ending the sexual exploitation of children around the world. This includes children trafficked for sexual purposes, and children sexually exploited through prostitution, in the travel and tourism sectors, and online. ECPAT and its global network of 104 members in 93 countries work collaboratively with partners and stakeholders at the global, regional and national levels to ensure that children everywhere enjoy their fundamental rights, and are protected from all forms of sexual exploitation. 700'000.00 Worldwide Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Strategic opportunities 2018 18 months (1 Feb 2018-30 Aug 2019)
